content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is a function that accomplishes what you described:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int=3)
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end

timezone_bumper(dt::Date, bump::Int=3) = throw(ErrorException("Function works only with DateTime types. A Date type was given."))
```
This function takes two arguments - a DateTime `dt` and an integer `bump` (which defaults to 3 if not provided). It adds `bump` hours to the DateTime. If you pass a Date type to this function, it will throw an error.
